snippet.textDisplay: This might be crazy late, but it's literally cherry water, a sweet and sour brandy, which can be used in a flattering way to mean "sweetie".

snippet.textDisplay: Kirschwasser is a kind of cherry brandy.
snippet.textOriginal: Kirschwasser is a kind of cherry brandy.

snippet.textDisplay: Kirshwasser as in fruit juice. As in what's left over after you've squeezed the life out of a peach ("peche").
snippet.textOriginal: Kirshwasser as in fruit juice. As in what's left over after you've squeezed the life out of a peach ("peche").

snippet.textDisplay: @Evilriku13 I think at least 'wasser' is a German word. It's water, I believe. Kirsch is some kind of brandy distilled from the fermented juice of cherries/berries. I wonder why they put those things together, lol.
snippet.textOriginal: @Evilriku13 I think at least 'wasser' is a German word. It's water, I believe. Kirsch is some kind of brandy distilled from the fermented juice of cherries/berries. I wonder why they put those things together, lol.

@basel, as a 34 year-old who remembers seeing the ol'JoJo manga and animé around in the  early '90s, I just wanted to add that back then I wouldn't have dared imagine that JoJo would have the kind of popularity that it has now. 

Seriously, it's all quite mind-blowing actually. Who'd have thunk... 💯

snippet.textDisplay: Wesker was an egomaniacal prick, he didn't care about the world, he only cared about proving he was superior to Spencer, the one who created him and shaped his life. He furthered the goal Spencer was following, only to give Spencer one last middle finger. As for Liquid... daddy issues. All he ever did, again, was try to do what Big Boss could not, only because Big Boss did not like him.
snippet.textOriginal: Wesker was an egomaniacal prick, he didn't care about the world, he only cared about proving he was superior to Spencer, the one who created him and shaped his life. He furthered the goal Spencer was following, only to give Spencer one last middle finger. As for Liquid... daddy issues. All he ever did, again, was try to do what Big Boss could not, only because Big Boss did not like him.

snippet.textDisplay: Umm, wesker and liquid aren't even remotely evil. They were fighting to change the world. Wesker was trying to further the evolution of man and liquid was trying to free the world from the tight grip that the patriots had on the world. They could both be iewd as protagonists if you agree with their end goal. Same with any good antagonist with substance out there. Hell, even hitler thought he was doing the right thing. He was by no means evil. His goal just became a sick mockary of goodness.
snippet.textOriginal: Umm, wesker and liquid aren't even remotely evil. They were fighting to change the world. snippet.textDisplay:
I've only played Xenogears from the series and I don't know who Albedo is, but Luca Blight from Suikoden II is damn sinister and also makes Kefka seem pretty civil.

Can't name many other villians that eat a handful of crossbow bolts in a surprise ambush and still takes eighteen heroes to down lol.

Shu: "Luca, you're luck has run out!! You have no soldiers and you're wounded! You can't break out of my trap!!!"
Luca: "You're trap? Wahahahahaha!! All I can see is a bunch of squealing pigs!!!"
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Uncensored version: he cracks the Realian's arm and then throws the corpse away. Scares MOMO with a knife and then cuts his arm and head with it. Head is seen talking in the ground.
Censored version: he drops the Realian's arm and you can't see when he gets rid of the corpse. He then scares MOMO by getting close to her and somehow cuts his arm, then proceeds to tear his head appart from his body with his bare hands. Head is seen talking in the ground next to the body. 
Which is creepier?
snippet.textOriginal:
Uncensored version: he cracks the Realian's arm and then throws the corpse away. Scares MOMO with a knife and then cuts his arm and head with it. Head is seen talking in the ground.
Censored version: he drops the Realian's arm and you can't see when he gets rid of the corpse. He then scares MOMO by getting close to her and somehow cuts his arm, then proceeds to tear his head appart from his body with his bare hands. Head is seen talking in the ground next to the body. 
Which is creepier?

snippet.textDisplay: @Darkmajesty22 I find that RPGs in general are really good at making Villains that when it boils down to it, even if you think their methods are selfish/abhorrent/monstrous/unethical, you really end up finding yourself resonating with some, if not all aspects, of their philosophy. This happened to me with the Killer from Persona 4, Kefka, Sephiroth, Xemnas, etc.
snippet.textOriginal: @Darkmajesty22 I find that RPGs in general are really good at making Villains that when it boils down to it, even if you think their methods are selfish/abhorrent/monstrous/unethical, you really end up finding yourself resonating with some, if not all aspects, of their philosophy. This happened to me with the Killer from Persona 4, Kefka, Sephiroth, Xemnas, etc.

snippet.textDisplay: Albedo is probably one of the most under rated villains in the history of ever. He puts Sephiroth to shame!
snippet.textOriginal: Albedo is probably one of the most under rated villains in the history of ever. He puts Sephiroth to shame!

snippet.textDisplay: Perhaps the greatest videogame villian of all time. In episode I we are treated to (by any RPG standards) one truly sick bastard with scene after scene of horrifying insanity. In the second game we gain first perspective insight of Albedo the innocent and naive child, learning the torment of what it means to live forever. After a good 5 or 6 years of playing I still believe that Albedo and Rubedo are two of the most fleshed out characters in RPG history. Sooooo much character development.
snippet.textOriginal: Perhaps the greatest videogame villian of all time. In episode I we are treated to (by any RPG standards) one truly sick bastard with scene after scene of horrifying insanity. In the second game we gain first perspective insight of Albedo the innocent and naive child, learning the torment of what it means to live forever. After a good 5 or 6 years of playing I still believe that Albedo and Rubedo are two of the most fleshed out characters in RPG history. Sooooo much character development.

snippet.textDisplay: Albedo reminds of the crazy uncle in the family who everyone is scared to invite to holiday dinners, but does anyway out of respect.  Then he goes on these long rants about things you don't care about or can't comprehend and you're sitting at the table afraid to make eye contact with him.  Good ole uncle Albedo. I miss Xenosaga!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
Most people seem to think, that Villians like Sephiroth, are "Bad Ass".(Hur Hur I have a big sword)
 It's really Villians like Albedo that shine. Unique Personality, a real past, and a truly devious agenda. Albedo is just so full of Character it's amazing, and really shames a lot of the other villains out there.

snippet.textDisplay: Personally, I think that Ep. I had the best music out of the entire Xenosaga series. Yasunori Mitsuda did a bunch of great pieces that I think Yuji Kajiura fell a little short of. I think "Last Battle" was the best song of the series...and in the following episodes, "Sweet Song" was the only thing that stuck in my head from Ep. II, and Ep. III didn't have any defining songs for me. Maybe it's because the London Philharmonic Orchestra played for Ep. I that I found it so likable ^_^...
snippet.textOriginal: Personally, I think that Ep. I had the best music out of the entire Xenosaga series. Yasunori Mitsuda did a bunch of great pieces that I think Yuji Kajiura fell a little short of. I think "Last Battle" was the best song of the series...and in the following episodes, "Sweet Song" was the only thing that stuck in my head from Ep. II, and Ep. III didn't have any defining songs for me. Maybe it's because the London Philharmonic Orchestra played for Ep. I that I found it so likable ^_^...

snippet.textDisplay: I think Albedo might be one of Crispen Freeman's greatest roles.  He's such a badass and now he's an -insane- badass.  There are so very few songs that could do the job of accurately capturing this incredible madman, but as to be expected of Xenosaga's soundtrack, it does it stellarly.
snippet.textOriginal: I think Albedo might be one of Crispen Freeman's greatest roles.  He's such a badass and now he's an -insane- badass.  There are so very few songs that could do the job of accurately capturing this incredible madman, but as to be expected of Xenosaga's soundtrack, it does it stellarly.
